javadoc: The AddressEvaluator class provides a way to evaluate a string that represents an address and resolve it to an address for a particular program.

methods.name: evaluate
methods.comment: Gets a legitimate address for the specified program as indicated by the string.

params.name: p
params.comment: the program to use for determining the address.

params.name: baseAddr
params.comment: the base address to use for relative addressing.

params.name: s
params.comment: string representation of the address desired.

return.comment:
the address. Otherwise, return null if the string fails to evaluate
 to a unique legitimate address.

methods.name: evaluate

params.name: p

methods.name: evaluate
methods.comment:
Utility method for creating an Address object from a byte array. The Address object may or may not
 be a legitimate Address in the program's address space. This method is meant to provide a way of
 creating an Address object from a sequence of bytes that can be used for additional tests and
 comparisons.

params.name: addrBytes
params.comment: - byte array to use containing the values the address will be constructed from.

return.comment:
- Address object constructed from the addrBytes array. Returns null if the program is null,
 addrBytes is null, or the length of addrBytes does not match the default Pointer size or does not contain
 a valid offset.

name: AddressEvaluator
comment:
The AddressEvaluator class provides a way to evaluate a string
 that represents an address and resolve it to an address for a particular program.
